title: What is FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried’s trial about?
description: Bankman-Fried, who had his bail revoked in August, faces multiple charges of money laundering and fraud.

title: EU dismisses doubts over long-term commitment to Ukraine in Kyiv meeting
description: While Western assistance for Ukraine remains robust, critics of that support have become increasingly vocal in EU, US.

title: Could US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy lose his job?
description: Hardline Republicans are threatening to oust their own party's speaker — using a rule McCarthy himself introduced.

title: Slovakia summons Russian embassy official to protest pre-election statement
description: Row centres on remarks by Russia's foreign intelligence service director about US 'interference' in the country.

title: Denis Mukwege, DRC’s Nobel prize winner, announces presidency bid
description: Nobel Peace Prize-winning doctor worked with victims of rape and brought attention to sexual violence during conflicts.

title: WHO recommends second malaria vaccine for children, rollout early next year
description: R21/Matrix-M vaccine, made by Serum Institute of India, is approved already for use in Burkina Faso, Ghana and Nigeria.

title: What is the Nobel Prize and what to expect this year?
description: There are 351 nominees for the Nobel Peace Prize this year.

title: ‘Music to Beijing’s ears’: Has China won the Maldives presidency?
description: Mohamed Muizzu's election win is a setback for India, a boost for China and a sign of tensions in Indian Ocean region.

title: Pussy Riot’s Tolokonnikova: ‘Russia wants me poisoned, dead, or in jail’
description: A founding member of the punk feminist art collective, who is wanted in Russia, talks to Al Jazeera.

title: The French government wants to ‘save’ Muslim women by controlling them
description: The recent abaya ban is yet another escalation of the French obsession with controlling the bodies of Muslim women.

title: Paola Egonu: Volleyball Star and Advocate for Change
description: The Italian sportswoman discusses her career, racism, and the importance of sisterhood in women's sports.

title: Climate leaders gather in Spain before ‘challenging’ COP28
description: Energy ministers and climate leaders from around the world gather in Madrid before the next month's climate summit.

title: The Ramadan War: A surprise assault that transformed the Middle East
description: Egypt and Syria were determined to recapture land previously taken by Israel. Things did not go according to plan.

title: EU foreign ministers in Ukraine’s Kyiv for unprecedented meeting abroad
description: Top diplomats of the bloc gather in Kyiv in the first-ever meeting outside the EU borders in show of solidarity.

title: NHS strikes: What ails UK health service? Doctors’ protests or budget cuts?
description: UK doctors have begun a 72-hour strike to demand pay hike and better working conditions amid cost of living crisis.

title: Stars, shocks and tragedies: The history of the ICC Cricket World Cup
description: Star players, upsets, and unforgettable moments - a roundup of the 47-year history of the ICC Cricket World Cup.

title: Sleepless Birds: Light pollution exposed
description: A French photographer exposes the environmental impact of light pollution from industrial greenhouses.

title: Trump’s civil fraud trial to begin in New York: What to know
description: This trial could determine whether Trump and his family can continue to do business in New York.

title: New millionaires, new music: How cybercrime was codified into Afrobeats
description: Late US official Colin Powell's dance 15 years ago was a seminal moment for Afrobeats, long before its global success.

title: Katalin Kariko, Drew Weissman win Nobel Prize in medicine for mRNA vaccines
description: The duo win the prestigious prize for the research that led directly to the first mRNA vaccines to fight COVID-19.

title: Fans frustrated over ‘very shoddy’ Cricket World Cup ticketing process
description: Amid the hype for the upcoming World Cup in India, fans complain of exorbitant prices and a chaotic ticket system.

title: Mexico church roof collapses during baptism killing at least 10 people
description: Three children are among the dead and dozens are injured in the incident in Ciudad Madero in the Tamaulipas state.

title: Early voting begins in Australia’s Indigenous Voice referendum
description: PM Anthony Albanese rallies support for Indigenous Voice in Melbourne as early voting begins in parts of Australia.

title: Trump says he will be in New York court for trial on his business practices
description: Judge has already ruled Trump and his two sons committed fraud in overstating the value of their business empire.

title: UK awards $4bn contract to build AUKUS nuclear submarines
description: SSN-AUKUS 'will be largest, most advanced and most powerful attack submarines ever operated' by Royal Navy, UK says.

title: Huge fire engulfs police complex in Egypt’s Ismailia
description: Videos show sprawling building ablaze with some parts appearing to collapse.

title: Anger and despair as Indonesian families mark year since football disaster
description: Some 135 people died after police fired tear gas into the stands of the Kanjuruhan Stadium.

title: Wagner’s Prigozhin hailed a hero, 40 days after death in plane crash
description: Dozens pay respects in several Russian cities on key date for mourning in the Eastern Orthodox church.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 586
description: As the war enters its 586th day, these are the main developments.
